Bride, Groom, Spy: How Wedding Detectives Are Running Matrimonial Industry - NDTV
summary:
The Rise of Wedding Detectives in India's Matrimonial Industry

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: NDTV

As more couples in India opt for love marriages instead of arranged ones, the demand for wedding detectives is growing. These professionals help families ensure that their children's prospective partners are suitable through discreet investigations.

  • The cost of hiring a wedding detective ranges from $100 to $2,000.
  • Families are increasingly turning to detectives to vet potential sons and daughters-in-law.
  • Matrimonial detective Bhavna Paliwal mentions that her agency handles about eight cases a month.
  • Investigations can reveal discrepancies, such as one case where a man claimed an annual salary of $70,700 but was actually earning $7,070.
  • Concerns around relationships, including fidelity and background, have made pre-marital checks common.
  • Private eyes also face challenges accessing properties due to modern security measures.
  • Advancements in technology have made it easier and safer for detectives to conduct surveillance.
‚ÄúNo relationship can work on the basis of lies.‚Äù - Bhavna Paliwal

The increasing complexity of relationships and societal changes in India have made the role of wedding detectives vital in navigating the changing matrimonial landscape.
newTitle: The Rise of Wedding Detectives in India's Matrimonial Industry

  • Vinod Kambli's pension is lower than that of cricketers' fathers.
  • Arjun Tendulkar's father, Sachin Tendulkar, receives Rs 70,000 per month.

  • The disparity raises questions about support for former cricketers.
"The pension disparity highlights the need for a review of BCCI's support for retired players."

WTC Final Scenarios: What are India's chances if Border-Gavaskar Trophy ends in a draw? - The Times of India
summary:
WTC Final Scenarios: What are India's chances if Border-Gavaskar Trophy ends in a draw?

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

The India-Australia Test series stands at a tense crossroads following the rain-affected draw in the third Test in Brisbane. With the five-match series level at 1-1, the remaining games in Melbourne and Sydney will be decisive, not just for the series outcome but also for the World Test Championship (WTC) Final qualification scenarios.

  • Scenario 1: Series Ends 2-2: India will have a percentage points tally (PCT) of 55.26%. Requires Australia to lose to Sri Lanka by at least 1-0 or South Africa to lose 2-0 to Pakistan.
  • Scenario 2: Series Ends 1-1: India's PCT drops to 53.51%. Requires South Africa to lose 2-0 to Pakistan or Australia to either lose 1-0 to Sri Lanka or draw with them.

India‚Äôs performance in the remaining Tests will be crucial, heavily influenced by external results as well as their consistency in batting and bowling.
newTitle: India's Chances in WTC Final if Border-Gavaskar Trophy Ends in a Draw

title: Champions Trophy 2025 To Follow Hybrid Model, PCB Gets Reciprocal Arrangement And 2028 Women's T20 World Cu - News18
summary:
ICC Confirms Hybrid Model For Champions Trophy 2025, India To Play Matches At Neutral Venue

Last Updated: December 19, 2024, 21:32 IST

In a major development, the ICC has confirmed that the 2025 Champions Trophy will be played in a Hybrid Model, allowing India to play their matches at a neutral venue due to security concerns over playing in Pakistan.

  • The tournament will feature eight teams, including India, Australia, England, New Zealand, South Africa, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, and hosts Pakistan.
  • The schedule for the tournament will be announced soon.
  • This decision aligns with the ICC's agreement that India and Pakistan matches during ICC events in the 2024-2027 cycle will occur at neutral venues.
  • The PCB has also been awarded hosting rights for the ICC Women‚Äôs T20 World Cup in 2028, which will follow the same model.
‚ÄúThe Champions Trophy was last held in 2017 when Pakistan defeated India to win their maiden title.‚Äù

The tournament is set for February-March 2025, with speculation around Sri Lanka co-hosting and the UAE as a likely venue for Indian matches.
newTitle: Champions Trophy 2025 To Follow Hybrid Model

India's Record Night and Mandhana's Record Year

Source: Not specified

In a remarkable T20I match, India achieved the highest women's T20I total of 217 for 4 against West Indies, while Smriti Mandhana set several records, including becoming the leading scorer in T20Is for the year 2024.

  • India's 217 for 4 is the highest T20I score against West Indies and in India.

title: WTC Final Scenarios: India's qualification chances if Border-Gavaskar Trophy ends in draw - The Times of India
summary:
WTC Final Scenarios: India's Qualification Chances in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

The India-Australia Test series stands at a tense crossroads following a draw in the third Test. With the five-match series level at 1-1, the outcomes of the remaining matches will not only determine the series winner but also India's chances for the World Test Championship Final.

  • If the series ends in a 2-2 draw, India needs Australia to lose to Sri Lanka, or South Africa to lose to Pakistan to qualify.
  • A 1-1 draw will lower India's qualification percentage, requiring similar unfavorable results for South Africa and Australia.
India must focus on consistency, particularly in batting and bowling, to enhance their chances.

The qualification for the WTC Final relies heavily on both their performance and the outcomes of other teams' matches.
